text: In a agile clinical system in retail where new members are onboarding and support teams must be enabled, what should the project manager do to outline expectations for the working environment?

options.label: co-create team norms on tools, cadence, and decision making

explanation: Option a is correct because joint norms build buy-in and clarity. Option b is incorrect because unstructured norms can conflict. Option c is incorrect because top-down rules reduce commitment. Option d is incorrect because ignoring needs harms collaboration.

text: Given a hybrid policy implementation in retail where teams are cross-functional and remote and several partners collaborate, which action best supports outline expectations for the working environment?

options.label: set norms once and never revisit
address time zones, availability, and collaboration expectations

explanation: Option b is correct because environment expectations must be explicit. Option a is incorrect because teams evolve and norms should too. Option c is incorrect because undocumented norms are easily forgotten. Option d is incorrect because unstructured norms can conflict.

text: While facing a vendor-led clinical system in pharma where teams are cross-functional and remote and several partners collaborate, what is the most effective next step to outline expectations for the working environment?

options.label: make norms visible and revisit regularly
set norms once and never revisit

explanation: Option c is correct because visibility and review sustain adoption. Option a is incorrect because top-down rules reduce commitment. Option b is incorrect because ignoring needs harms collaboration. Option d is incorrect because teams evolve and norms should too.

text: For a federated POS refresh in fintech where handoffs across time zones are rough and delivery pressure is high, what should the project manager do first to outline expectations for the working environment?
explanation: Option d is correct because leaders set tone for the environment. Option a is incorrect because undocumented norms are easily forgotten. Option b is incorrect because unstructured norms can conflict. Option c is incorrect because top-down rules reduce commitment.

text: In a matrixed POS refresh in fintech where teams are cross-functional and remote and delivery pressure is high, what should the project manager do to outline expectations for the working environment?

options.label: include partners and vendors in the norms
set norms once and never revisit

explanation: Option a is correct because all contributors need shared expectations. Option b is incorrect because ignoring needs harms collaboration. Option c is incorrect because teams evolve and norms should too. Option d is incorrect because undocumented norms are easily forgotten.
